channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Nicole Precel
item.description: Homicide squad detectives are investigating the death of a man, who was found with multiple wounds, in South Melbourne.
item.title: Homicide squad investigate death in South Melbourne

item.dc:creator: Jacqueline Maley
item.description: Eminent jurist, a loner, the Great Dissenter, a brilliant legal mind: former High Court justice Dyson Heydon's treatment of women tarnishes his legacy.
item.title: Dyson's 'dirty deeds': the public v private face of 'sexual harasser'

item.dc:creator: Nick McKenzie
item.description: A former special forces medic’s journey of reconciliation with the family of a dead Afghan farmer comes as a war crimes inquiry examining allegations of serious misconduct prepares its final report.
item.title: 'I was sorry': Australian soldier's journey to Afghanistan for forgiveness

item.description: The Japanese-inspired practice of shinrin-yoku – literally, “forest bath” – is becoming a worldwide wellness phenomenon.
item.title: The healing benefits of forest therapy

item.description: Texas and Florida have staged their biggest retreat in reopening yet amid a surge that sent the number of confirmed new coronavirus infections per day in the US to an all-time high of 40,000.
item.title: New coronavirus cases hit an all-time high in the US

item.description: Omar Garcia Harfuch was shot and injured and two of his bodyguards were killed in the dramatic assassination attempt just before dawn.
item.title: Mexico City police chief shot in assassination attempt

item.dc:creator: Bevan Shields
item.description: A man has been shot dead by police and at least six people are in hospital after a stabbing attack at a hotel in Glasgow's city centre.
item.title: Suspect shot dead after mass stabbing in Glasgow

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, June 27, 2020

item.dc:creator: Jordan Baker
item.description: If the government's changes pass, students will pay a greater proportion of the domestic teaching bill than the Commonwealth for the first time in decades.
item.title: 'Tumultuous': The seismic change hidden in Tehan's plans for unis

item.dc:creator: Tony Wright
item.description: Barry Jones has devoted his life to learning. At 88, he is still revising his magnum opus: the 910,000-word Dictionary of World Biography.
item.title: Barry Jones, still hauling around his loaded cart of knowledge

item.dc:creator: Kate McClymont
item.description: Former High Court judge Dyson Heydon allegedly sexually harassed young women while he was Trade Unions royal commissioner.
item.title: Fresh allegations levelled against ex-judge Dyson Heydon

item.dc:creator: Vince Rugari
item.description: "If you ask anyone back in those days where they wanted football to go, they'd say right here, right now," said inaugural captain Julie Dolan.
item.title: 'Unimaginable dream' comes to life for the Matildas pioneers of 1979

item.dc:creator: Rob Harris
item.description: An ABC plan to expand its regional coverage if the federal government reversed budget cuts was ignored and kept secret from National Party MPs.
item.title: ABC plan to expand regional coverage was ignored and kept secret

item.dc:creator: Chris Barrett
item.description: The Australian Anti-Doping Authority has contacted the global watchdog about the sport scientist's absence from its official Prohibited Association List.
item.title: Stephen Dank strangely missing from WADA list of people barred from sport

item.dc:creator: Julia Baird
item.description: Just as accused sexual harassers seems to follow a pattern, so too does the protection afforded them.
item.title: A single question reverberates throughout the Dyson Heydon affair

item.dc:creator: Chris Barrett
item.description: Isaac Moses wields enormous power with more than 50 NRL players, including Cameron Smith, on his books as well as several head coaches. But his empire is in danger of crashing down.
item.title: Agent of influence: The rise and fall of the NRL's manager to the stars

item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Farrelly
item.description: If we’re serious about this tearing down of the exploiters and colonisers we need a total mindset transplant.
item.title: Toppling statues won't be enough to save us from the next Great Dying

item.dc:creator: James Massola
item.description: A remote group of islands is becoming the scene of a major geopolitical stand-off, with Beijing making the running so far.
item.title: Natuna: an idyll on the front line between Indonesia and China

item.dc:creator: Tony Moore
item.description: 'It's like losing your family' two 30-year veterans of The Queensland Times say as the Ipswich daily newspaper shifts from newspaper to an online site after 160 years of publishing.
item.title: Queensland's oldest newspaper stops printing after 160 years

item.dc:creator: Nick Miller
item.description: In the midst of the COVID-19 lockdown, the producer of Harry Potter and the Cursed Child gave the federal arts minister a crash course in putting on a show.
item.title: How Harry Potter helped save Australia's arts industry

item.dc:creator: Lydia Lynch
item.description: Queenslanders will remain in the dark over the weekend about whether or not the state's borders will reopen on July 10.
item.title: Queenslanders none the wiser about border reopening date

item.dc:creator: Sarah Danckert
item.description: Much of the focus on Virgin's new owner Bain Capital has centred on local boss, former Olympian Mike Murphy,. But the role of Jayne Hrdlicka was just as important.
item.title: Jayne Hrdlicka: The high-flying executive behind Bain's turbulent Virgin tilt

item.dc:creator: Nick O'Malley
item.description: Labor’s bipartisan push on climate policy has been met with criticism that they are failing in their duty as an opposition party.
item.title: Labor’s climate policy: olive branch or white feather?

item.dc:creator: Clancy Yeates
item.description: Judo Bank co-founder Joseph Healy warns small and medium businesses are taking on $25 billion in unproductive debt to survive the pandemic.
item.title: Judo Bank's Joseph Healy warns on 'zombie firms'

item.dc:creator: Pallavi Singhal
item.description: Some Sydney suburbs have recorded COVID-19 testing rates that are three times the state-wide average and there has been a significant spike in testing among school-aged children since the beginning of June.
item.title: The postcodes testing for COVID-19 at three times the average rate

item.dc:creator: Emma Koehn
item.description: US biotech Illumina says it sees big potential in Australia, as research COVID-19 and serious diseases puts global companies in spotlight.
item.title: COVID-19 spotlight prompts calls for genomics roadmap

item.dc:creator: Simon Johanson
item.description: The value of the property portfolios held by Australia’s real estate trusts are diverging sharply with some proving more resilient to the pandemic’s effects than others.
item.title: Values diverge for Australia's property trusts

item.description: Now is the time to boost funding to the ABC, not decrease it, more jobs not fewer.
item.title: Don't forget, a privatised ABC is the Libs' goal

item.dc:creator: John McDonald
item.description: The art critic says the closure of the Powerhouse Museum in Ultimo will be the greatest cultural crime in Australian history.
item.title: New Powerhouse not a museum but global 'embarrassment'

item.dc:creator: Aimie Rigas
item.description: 'The overhaul of university funding is really significant ... I think the comments speak to how passionate people are about Australia's education system.'
item.title: Readers debate government's changes to university fees

item.dc:creator: Nicole Lindsay
item.description: Queensland shoe maker FRANKiE4 is making a foray into Victoria, opening a shop on the Burke Road shopping strip.
item.title: Interstate retailers make border crossings

item.dc:creator: Josh Dye
item.description: Public hearings into the controversial redevelopment begin in two weeks after the majority of submissions to a parliamentary inquiry opposed the project.
item.title: Fresh spotlight on War Memorial expansion after National Gallery cuts

item.dc:creator: Andrew Hornery
item.description: Danil Akram, whose turnover has plummeted by more than 85 per cent, is embroiled in heated negotiations with his landlord, the NSW Land and Housing Corporation.
item.title: Sydney restaurateur in stoush with government over COVID rent reduction

item.dc:creator: Sophie Aubrey
item.description: Nine-year-old Tilly chose to draw herself skateboarding, a skill her dad taught her during “the sickness”.
item.title: What life during COVID-19 has looked like, according to kids

item.dc:creator: Melanie Kembrey
item.description: Publishers are racing to carve out a space in an increasingly crowded market
item.title: A wave of COVID-19 titles is set to hit bookshelves – will people read them?

item.description: It's time to be more flexible, and not more rigid, about career planning.
item.title: The wisdom of flexible plans

item.dc:creator: Peter Hannam
item.description: The government will create a conservation area in far north-west NSW 10 times the size of the Royal National Park, in the largest purchase of private land for environmental protection in the state's history.
item.title: NSW lands biggest conservation purchase in state's history

item.description: Haunted by the killing of an Afghan farmer, an Australian army medic sought out his sons.
item.title: Age tablet interactive: 'I'm so sorry': An Australian soldier, an Afghan son and a death that can’t be forgotten

item.description: Haunted by the killing of an Afghan farmer, an Australian army medic sought out his sons.
item.title: Tablet interactive: 'I'm so sorry': An Australian soldier, an Afghan son and a death that can’t be forgotten

item.description: Danil Akram, whose turnover has plummeted, is embroiled in negotiations with his landlord.
item.title: Tablet interactive: Sydney restaurateur in stoush with government over COVID rent reduction

item.description: A week in photos from the award winning Sydney Morning Herald and Australian Financial Review photographers
item.title: Photos of the week, June 26, 2020

item.dc:creator: Aisha Dow
item.description: Coronavirus infections with an unknown source are at their highest levels since the pandemic reached Victoria, placing the state in a “dangerous situation”.
item.title: 'Dangerous situation': Cases of COVID-19 with unknown source tap new high

item.dc:creator: Chip Le Grand
item.description: For the first time in this pandemic, the Victorian government was uncertain of its next move.
item.title: Andrews calls in the troops, then retreats

item.dc:creator: Melissa Cunningham
item.description: Victorian authorities are being urged to push the use of face masks on public transport and at other busy public spaces to slow the spread of coronavirus.
item.title: Wear face masks on public transport and while shopping, experts say

item.dc:creator: Vince Rugari
item.description: Collingwood coach Nathan Buckley is bracing for a lengthy spell without the star backman, who was involved in a gruesome collision with GWS Giants midfielder Jacob Hopper.
item.title: 'We won't see him for a while': Pies star Howe suffers major knee injury

item.dc:creator: Danny Katz
item.description: Too much thinking creates unnecessary brain-baggage and we should take advantage of our current COVID-enforced stillness to clear our heads, engage with our senses, and be present to the wonders of the world.
item.title: So I went online and watched an Eckhart Tolle lecture...

item.description: Herein lies the conundrum that surrounds sex today, with men being told to respect women’s rights and wants while pop culture reinforces stereotypes of women craving domination.
item.title: Is it any wonder society is so screwed up about sex?

item.description: The former Wimbledon champion attended Djokovic's player's exhibition series in Serbia and Croatia this month and is the latest participant to test positive.
item.title: Novak Djokovic's coach Goran Ivanisevic tests positive for coronavirus

item.description: The week in photos from award-winning Sydney Morning Herald photographers.
item.title: Photos of the week

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted in the work of our award-winning cartoonists.
item.title: Today's cartoons: The illustrated news
